anon 0.0.0.9000

Extract Named Entities from Text

nlp_get.Rd

These functions extract different types of named entities from text using natural language processing. Each function specializes in extracting a specific type of entity.

Usage

nlp_get_dates(x)

nlp_get_locations(x)

nlp_get_money(x)

nlp_get_organizations(x)

nlp_get_percentages(x)

nlp_get_people(x)

Arguments

x

A character vector

Value

A character vector of unique extracted entities of the specified type. Returns an empty character vector if no entities are found or if processing fails.

Details

The functions use OpenNLP's named entity recognition capabilities to identify:

  • nlp_get_dates(): Date expressions

  • nlp_get_locations(): Geographic locations and place names

  • nlp_get_money(): Monetary amounts and currency expressions

  • nlp_get_organizations(): Organization and company names

  • nlp_get_percentages(): Percentage expressions

  • nlp_get_people(): Person names

The functions handle missing values and empty input gracefully. Text that is too short or contains no alphabetic characters is skipped.

See also

annotate for text annotation functionality, Maxent_Entity_Annotator for named entity recognition, Maxent_Sent_Token_Annotator and Maxent_Word_Token_Annotator for text tokenization.

The openNLPmodels.en package provides the Apache OpenNLP models for the English language that are required for these functions to work.

The entity package on GitHub (https://github.com/trinker/entity) provided inspiration for these functions.

Examples

text <- c("John Smith works at Microsoft in Seattle.", 
          "The deal was worth $1.2 million in 2023.")
          
nlp_get_people(text)
#> [1] "John Smith"
nlp_get_organizations(text)
#> [1] "Microsoft"
nlp_get_locations(text)
#> [1] "Seattle"
nlp_get_money(text)
#> [1] "$1.2 million"
nlp_get_dates(text)
#> [1] "2023"
